metadata.title: CVE-2016-9190 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Pillow before 3.3.2 allows context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrarycode by using the "crafted image file" approach, related to an "InsecureSign Extension" issue affecting the ImagingNew in Storage.c component.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9190` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.1
python-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.1
python-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.1
python3-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.1
python3-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-0ubuntu1.1').
